summary.paragraph: perldiver is a CGI program that will tell you interesting things about the Perl configuration on your web server. This includes the version of Perl and all modules installed.

file.filedesc: This file. Instructions on how to install and use perldiver.

introduction.paragraph: There is no configuration required for perldiver.

installation.paragraph: perldiver is installed simply by copying the file perldiver.pl.pl into your cgi-bin directory. If you don't know where your cgi-bin directory is, then please ask your system administrator
You may need to rename perldiver.pl to perldiver.cgi. Again, your system administrator will know if this is the case.

You will probably need to turn on execute permissions to the file. You can do this by running the command "chmod +x perldiver.pl" from your command line. If you don't have command line access to your web server then there will probably be an equivalent function in your file transfer program.
